metadata.Title: CVE-2020-8036 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
The tok2strbuf() function in tcpdump 4.10.0-PRE-GIT was used by the SOME/IP dissector in an unsafe way.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8036` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

tcpdump - 4.99.0-2
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> introduced in the 4.10 tcpdump devel cycle.

criterions.comment: tcpdump package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.99.0-2').
